description: Borrowed from French, either from Old French goitron (“throat, neck, goitre”), itself from Vulgar Latin *gutturiō, *gutturiōnem (“throat, goitre-like protrusions”), from Latin guttur, or a back-formation from French goitreux (“goitered”).

entries.meaning: (pathology, UK) An enlargement of the front and sides of the neck caused by inflammation of the thyroid gland.
